item.title: Amy add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Amy add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Amy add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "It takes courage to love, but pain through love is the purifying fire which those who love generously know. We all know people who are so much afraid of pain that they shut themselves up like clams in a shell and, giving out nothing, receive nothing and therefore shrink until life is a mere living death." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Amy add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I have lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.' You must do the thing you think you cannot do." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Amy add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Amy add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Amy add a quote by Thomas Szasz
item.description: "Two wrongs don't make a right, but they make a good excuse." -- Thomas Szasz

item.title: Amy add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Amy add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it." -- Mae West

item.title: Amy add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it." -- Mae West

item.title: Amy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Amy add a quote by Charles Lamb
item.description: "I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early." -- Charles Lamb

item.title: Amy add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Amy add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Amy add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "We accept the love we think we deserve." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Amy add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "It is a defect of God's humor that he directs our hearts everywhere but to those who have a right to them." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Amy add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Amy add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "When I look back, I am so impressed again with the life-giving power of literature. If I were a young person today, trying to gain a sense of myself in the world, I would do that again by reading, just as I did when I was young." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Amy add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "From there to here, from here to there, funny things are everywhere!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Amy add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You're off to Great Places! Today is your day! Your mountain is waiting, So... get on your way!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Amy add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "If you never did you should. These things are fun and fun is good." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Amy add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Amy add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Amy add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Amy add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Amy add a quote by Marthe Troly-Curtin
item.description: "Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time." -- Marthe Troly-Curtin

item.title: Amy add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "As usual, there is a great woman behind every idiot." -- John Lennon

item.title: Amy add a quote by Cheris Kramarae
item.description: "Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings." -- Cheris Kramarae

item.title: Amy add a quote by virginia woolf
item.description: "As a woman I have no country. As a woman I want no country. As a woman, my country is the whole world." -- virginia woolf

item.title: Amy add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I'm no model lady. A model's just an imitation of the real thing." -- Mae West
